member.name: T:Linkar.Functions.Persistent.TABLE.LinkarClient
member.summary: These functions perform synchronous and asynchronous persistent (establishing permanent session) operations with output format type TABLE.

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Persistent.TABLE.LinkarClient.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinkarClient class.
member.param: Maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. Default = 0 to wait indefinitely. When the receiveTimeout argument is omitted in any operation, the value set here will be applied.

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Persistent.TABLE.LinkarClient.Login(Linkar.CredentialOptions,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts the communication with a server allowing making use of the rest of functions until the Close method is executed or the connection with the server gets lost, synchronously only.
member.param: Object with data necessary to access the Linkar Server: Username, Password, EntryPoint, Language, FreeText.
Free text sent to the database allows management of additional behaviours in SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM, which is called when this parameter is set.
Maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. Default = 0 to wait indefinitely.
member.remarks: Login is actually a "virtual" operation which creates a new Client Session ID. No DBMS login is performed unless Linkar SERVER determines new Database Sessions are required - these operations are not related.

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Persistent.TABLE.LinkarClient.Logout(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Closes the communication with the server, that previously has been opened with a Login function, synchronously only.
member.param: Free text sent to the database allows management of additional behaviours in SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM, which is called when this parameter is set.
Maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. Default = 0 to wait indefinitely.
member.remarks: Logout is actually a "virtual" operation which disposes the current Client Session ID. No DBMS logout is performed.

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Persistent.TABLE.LinkarClient.LkSchemas(Linkar.Functions.LkSchemasOptions,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a list of all the Schemas defined in Linkar Schemas, or the EntryPoint account data files, synchronously only, with TABLE output format.
member.param: This object defines the different options in base of the asked Schema Type: LKSCHEMAS, SQLMODE o DICTIONARIES.
Free text sent to the database allows management of additional behaviours in SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM, which is called when this parameter is set.
Maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. Default = 0 to wait indefinitely.

example.code:
Imports Linkar Imports Linkar.Functions.Persistent.TABLE
Class Test
Public Function MyLkSchemas() As String Dim result As String = ""
Try Dim credentials As CredentialOptions = New CredentialOptions("127.0.0.1", "EPNAME", 11300, "admin", "admin")
Dim client As LinkarClient = New LinkarClient()
client.Login(credentials) Dim options As LkSchemasOptions = New LkSchemasOptions(RowHeaders.TYPE.MAINLABEL, False, False); result = client.LkSchemas(options) client.Logout()
Catch ex As Exception
Dim[error] As String = ex.Message ' Do something End Try
Return result End Function End Class

member.remarks:
TABLE output format uses the defined control characters in EntryPoints Parameters Table Row Separator and Column Row Separator.
By default:
TAB char (9) for columns.
VT char (11) for rows.

member.name: M:Linkar.Functions.Persistent.TABLE.LinkarClient.GetTable(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Linkar.Functions.TableOptions,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a query result in a table format, synchronously only, with TABLE output format.
member.param: File or table name defined in Linkar Schemas. Table notation is: MainTable[.MVTable[.SVTable]]
Statement fragment specifies the selection condition. For example WITH CUSTOMER = '1'

Space-delimited list of dictionaries to read. If this list is not set, all fields are returned. For example CUSTOMER DATE ITEM. In NONE mode you may use the format LKFLDx where x is the attribute number.
Statement fragment specifies the selection order. If there is a selection rule Linkar will execute a SSELECT, otherwise Linkar will execute a SELECT. For example BY CUSTOMER
Detailed options to be used, including: rowHeaders, rowProperties, onlyVisibe, usePropertyNames, repeatValues, applyConversion, applyFormat, calculated, pagination, regPage, numPage.
Free text sent to the database allows management of additional behaviours in SUB.LK.MAIN.CONTROL.CUSTOM, which is called when this parameter is set.
Maximum time in seconds that the client will wait for a response from the server. Default = 0 to wait indefinitely.
